channel.title: Ren Hale
channel.description: Personal website of Ren Hale, indie web developer and digital craftsman. Articles, notes, and thoughts on web development, indie web principles, and digital craftsmanship.

item.title: Building My First Indie Web Site
item.description: After years of building sites for others, I finally decided to create my own space on the indie web. Here's what I learned about microformats, webmentions, and the beauty of owning your own domain.

item.title: Creating a Solarized Design System
item.description: The solarized color palette isn't just for code editors. I've been experimenting with using it for web design, and the results are surprisingly elegant and readable.

item.title: Why Web Standards Still Matter
item.description: In a world of ever-changing frameworks and tools, web standards provide the foundation for a more accessible, interoperable, and sustainable web.

item.title: The Art of Minimal Web Development
item.description: Sometimes the best solution is the unknown one. Here's how I approach web development with minimalism in mind, focusing on what truly matters.

item.title: The Beauty of Simple Tools
item.description: Sometimes the most powerful tools are the simplest ones. A text editor, a terminal, and a browser can build almost anything. The complexity often comes from trying to solve problems that don't exist yet.

item.title: Indie Web Philosophy
item.description: The indie web isn't about rejecting modern toolsâ€”it's about choosing tools that serve you, not the other way around. Own your data, own your voice, own your space.

item.title: Learning in Public
item.description: There's something powerful about documenting your learning process. It helps you understand better, and it might help someone else too. Imperfection is part of the journey.

item.title: Thoughtful Technology
item.description: Technology should enhance human connection, not replace it. Every tool we build should make us more human, not less.
